bestBHT.bht: Scripture declares that Jesus is the stone that the builders rejected but has now become the head of the corner. This reference to Psalm 118:22 emphasizes Jesus' exalted position above both angels and men. It serves as a reminder of the fulfillment of prophecy and the divine plan that unfolded through Jesus' life and ministry. This scripture showcases the significance of Jesus as the cornerstone, despite his initial rejection, and highlights his ultimate authority and importance.

Marvin Vincent: Scripture [γραφην] . A passage of scripture : hence frequently this scripture; another scripture; the same scripture. Luke 4:21; John 19:37; Acts 1:16.
Archibald T. Robertson: This scripture (την γραφην ταυτην). This passage of scripture (Luke 4:21; John 19:37; Acts 1:16). It is a quotation from Psalms 118:22. See on Matthew 21:42 for discussion.
John Gill: And have ye not read this Scripture?... In Psalms 118:22"
the stone which the builders rejected, is become the head of the corner
he was to be, and now is become, the head of the corner, exalted above angels and men

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse references a passage of scripture from Psalms 118:22, which states that the stone which the builders rejected, is become the head of the corner. This scripture is significant as it speaks to the exalted position that Jesus holds as the cornerstone, despite being rejected by those who should have recognized his importance. It emphasizes his elevated status above both angels and men. This verse serves as a reminder of the fulfillment of prophecy and the divine plan that unfolded through Jesus' life and ministry.

Scripture declares that Jesus is the stone that the builders rejected but has now become the head of the corner. This scripture showcases the significance of Jesus as the cornerstone, despite his initial rejection, and highlights his ultimate authority and importance.

Scripture affirms that the stone which the builders rejected has become the head of the corner. This scripture from Psalm 118:22 underscores the fulfilled prophecy of Jesus' exalted position above angels and men. It serves as a reminder of the divine plan that unfolded through Jesus' life and ministry, highlighting his significance as the cornerstone, despite initial rejection. This verse highlights Jesus' ultimate authority and importance, portraying him as the pivotal figure in God's redemptive plan.

This passage highlights Jesus' ultimate authority and significance, illustrating his pivotal role in God's redemptive work.
